body_html:
Hi,

After some debugging I found the error:
tensorflow/contrib/lite/simple_memory_arena.cc:82 it->size != alloc.size (4 != 0)

It happens on the first allocation,

The initialization succeeded but it fails with this allocation, can you please give me some directions where to look?

My model is very basic and consists weights and biases:

def my_model(patches, hidden_init):

    patches = tf.reshape(patches, (101, 14, 14, 3))
    hidden_init = tf.reshape(hidden_init, shape=[1, 512])

    conv1 = tf.layers.conv2d(patches, 32, [3, 3], activation=tf.nn.relu, name='conv1')
    pool1 = tf.layers.max_pooling2d(conv1, 2, 2)

    output = tf.identity(pool1, 'output')

Thanks

body:
Hi,

After some debugging I found the error:
tensorflow/contrib/lite/simple_memory_arena.cc:82 it->size != alloc.size (4 != 0)

It happens on the first allocation,

The initialization succeeded but it fails with this allocation, can you please give me some directions where to look?

My model is very basic and consists weights and biases:

    def my_model(patches, hidden_init):

        patches = tf.reshape(patches, (101, 14, 14, 3))
        hidden_init = tf.reshape(hidden_init, shape=[1, 512])

        conv1 = tf.layers.conv2d(patches, 32, [3, 3], activation=tf.nn.relu, name='conv1')
        pool1 = tf.layers.max_pooling2d(conv1, 2, 2)

        output = tf.identity(pool1, 'output')

Thanks
